author: Amarnath Tewary
text:
“It was a fight of political ideologies and the BJP hatched a conspiracy to send my son to jail. But justice has been delivered and I’m very happy that Kanhaiya has got bail today,” Mr Singh said.

Amid celebratory hugs and congratulatory words from villagers, well-wishers and relatives, Kanhaiya’s younger brother, Prince Kumar, said they had been waiting for this moment for several days.

When reminded that it was only an interim bail, Prince Kumar said they had “full faith in the judicial system and we’ll get permanent relief too from the court.”

“It’s a temporary relief but the battle is still there to be won and we’ll definitely win,” Prince Kumar said, adding that “the family and the villagers are now waiting for Kanhaiya to return to the village so that he is given a hero’s welcome.”

Kanhaiya’s elder brother Manikant Singh, an uncle and other relatives have been camping in Delhi for the past several days.

Their family has been supporting the Left since long, with their uncle being a prominent Left party leader of the area.

Last month, some art students from Shantiniketan and Patna had gone to Kanhaiya’s village and lent their support to the family through graffitis and slogans inscribed on the walls of Kanhaiya’s mud-and-brick house.
title: ‘Justice delivered’
